question_text: A device on your network consistently gets the same IP address from DHCP even after lease expiration. What configuration most likely explains this?
answer_options: The scope is too small to rotate IPs
The device has a static IP conflict
The DHCP server uses a reservation tied to the MAC address
DHCP is set to broadcast-only mode
correct_answer: The DHCP server uses a reservation tied to the MAC address
explanation: A DHCP reservation ensures the same IP is always given to a specific MAC address.
